humanum_full_description_en:
From the sound of " heart " and " non ", the original meaning is grief and sadness. "Shuowen": "The pain is also from the heart, not the sound." "Poetry‧Binfeng‧July": "The female heart is sad, and the son goes back together.

" Sorrow " can mean tragic, strong and sad. Tang Dufu "Sufu": "Yong Ye Jiao said sadly to himself, who will see the moon in the sky."

" Sorrow " also means longing and sadness . "Historical Records: The Benji of Gaozu": "The wandering son is sorrowful for his hometown. Although I am in Guanzhong, my soul will be full of joy after long live."

" Sorrow " also means sadness and moving. Han Wangchong "Lun Heng·Zi Ji": "Gai Shikuan tunes, and the songs are all sad."

" Sorrow " also expresses pity. "Historical Records: Biography of Bian Quecang": "The book is heard and sad, and the criminal law is also removed at this age."

" Sorrow " is also used in Buddhism to express willingness to relieve the pain of others. "Great Wisdom-Great Mercy and Compassion in Shi Chupin": "Great Compassion, to extricate all sentient beings from suffering."

humanum_full_description:
從「心」，「非」聲，本義為哀痛、傷心。《說文》：「痛也。从心，非聲。」《詩‧豳風‧七月》：「女心傷悲，殆及公子同歸。」

　　「悲」可表示悲壯、悲涼。唐杜甫〈宿府〉：「永夜角聲悲自語，中天月色好誰看。」

　　「悲」也表示思念、悵念。《史記‧高祖本紀》：「游子悲故鄉。吾雖都關中，萬歲後吾魂魄猶樂思沛。」

　　「悲」還表示悲感動人。漢王充《論衡‧自紀》：「蓋師曠調音，曲無不悲。」

　　「悲」亦表示憐憫。《史記‧扁鵲倉公列傳》：「書聞，上悲其意，此歲中亦除肉刑法。」

　　「悲」也用作佛教語，表示願解他人痛苦之心。《大智度論‧釋初品中大慈大悲》：「大悲，拔一切眾生苦。」
